title: Google\Cloud\PubSub\V1\Gapic\PublisherGapicClient
name: PublisherGapicClient
description:
Service Description: The service that an application uses to manipulate topics, and to send messages to a topic.

EXPERIMENTAL: This client library class has not yet been declared GA (1.0). This means that even though we intend the surface to be stable, we may make backwards incompatible changes if necessary.

This class provides the ability to make remote calls to the backing service through method calls that map to API methods. Sample code to get started:

$publisherClient = new PublisherClient();
try {
    $formattedName = $publisherClient->topicName('[PROJECT]', '[TOPIC]');
    $response = $publisherClient->createTopic($formattedName);
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();
}

Many parameters require resource names to be formatted in a particular way. To assist with these names, this class includes a format method for each type of name, and additionally a parseName method to extract the individual identifiers contained within formatted names that are returned by the API.

methods.name: projectName
methods.description: Formats a string containing the fully-qualified path to represent a project resource.

methods.name: topicName
methods.description: Formats a string containing the fully-qualified path to represent a topic resource.

methods.name: parseName
methods.description:
Parses a formatted name string and returns an associative array of the components in the name.

The following name formats are supported: Template: Pattern

  • project: projects/{project}
  • topic: projects/{project}/topics/{topic}.

The optional $template argument can be supplied to specify a particular pattern, and must match one of the templates listed above. If no $template argument is provided, or if the $template argument does not match one of the templates listed, then parseName will check each of the supported templates, and return the first match.

params.name: formattedName
params.description: The formatted name string

params.name: template
params.description: Optional name of template to match

returns.description: An associative array from name component IDs to component values.

params.name: options
params.description: Optional. Options for configuring the service API wrapper.

params.name: options.serviceAddress
params.description: The domain name of the API remote host. Default 'pubsub.googleapis.com'.

params.name: options.port
params.description: The port on which to connect to the remote host. Default 443.

params.name: options.channel
params.description: A Channel object. If not specified, a channel will be constructed. NOTE: This option is only valid when utilizing the gRPC transport.

params.name: options.sslCreds
params.description: A ChannelCredentials object for use with an SSL-enabled channel. Default: a credentials object returned from \Grpc\ChannelCredentials::createSsl(). NOTE: This option is only valid when utilizing the gRPC transport. Also, if the $channel optional argument is specified, then this argument is unused.

params.name: options.forceNewChannel
params.description: If true, this forces gRPC to create a new channel instead of using a persistent channel. Defaults to false. NOTE: This option is only valid when utilizing the gRPC transport. Also, if the $channel optional argument is specified, then this option is unused.

params.name: options.credentialsLoader
params.description: A CredentialsLoader object created using the Google\Auth library.

params.name: options.scopes
params.description: A string array of scopes to use when acquiring credentials. Defaults to the scopes for the Google Cloud Pub/Sub API.

params.name: options.clientConfigPath
params.description: Path to a JSON file containing client method configuration, including retry settings. Specify this setting to specify the retry behavior of all methods on the client. By default this settings points to the default client config file, which is provided in the resources folder. The retry settings provided in this option can be overridden by settings in $retryingOverride

params.name: options.retryingOverride
params.description: An associative array in which the keys are method names (e.g. 'createFoo'), and the values are retry settings to use for that method. The retry settings for each method can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage. Passing a value of null is equivalent to a value of ['retriesEnabled' => false]. Retry settings provided in this setting override the settings in $clientConfigPath.

params.name: options.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver PSR-7 requests specifically for authentication. Should match a signature of function (RequestInterface $request, array $options) : ResponseInterface.

params.name: options.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver PSR-7 requests. Should match a signature of function (RequestInterface $request, array $options) : PromiseInterface. NOTE: This option is only valid when utilizing the REST transport.

params.name: options.transport
params.description: The transport used for executing network requests. May be either the string rest or grpc. Additionally, it is possible to pass in an already instantiated transport. Defaults to grpc if gRPC support is detected on the system.

methods.name: createTopic
methods.description:
Creates the given topic with the given name.

Sample code:

$publisherClient = new PublisherClient();
try {
    $formattedName = $publisherClient->topicName('[PROJECT]', '[TOPIC]');
    $response = $publisherClient->createTopic($formattedName);
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();
}

params.name: name
params.description: The name of the topic. It must have the format "projects/{project}/topics/{topic}". {topic} must start with a letter, and contain only letters ([A-Za-z]), numbers ([0-9]), dashes (-), underscores (_), periods (.), tildes (~), plus (+) or percent signs (%). It must be between 3 and 255 characters in length, and it must not start with "goog".

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.labels
params.description: User labels.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. Can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage.

methods.name: updateTopic
methods.description:
Updates an existing topic. Note that certain properties of a topic are not modifiable. Options settings follow the style guide: NOTE: The style guide requires body: "topic" instead of body: "*".

Keeping the latter for internal consistency in V1, however it should be corrected in V2. See https://cloud.google.com/apis/design/standard_methods#update for details.

Sample code:

$publisherClient = new PublisherClient();
try {
    $topic = new Topic();
    $updateMask = new FieldMask();
    $response = $publisherClient->updateTopic($topic, $updateMask);
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();
}

params.name: topic
params.description: The topic to update.

params.name: updateMask
params.description: Indicates which fields in the provided topic to update. Must be specified and non-empty.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. Can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage.

methods.name: publish
methods.description:
Adds one or more messages to the topic. Returns NOT_FOUND if the topic does not exist. The message payload must not be empty; it must contain either a non-empty data field, or at least one attribute.

Sample code:

$publisherClient = new PublisherClient();
try {
    $formattedTopic = $publisherClient->topicName('[PROJECT]', '[TOPIC]');
    $data = '';
    $messagesElement = new PubsubMessage();
    $messagesElement->setData($data);
    $messages = [$messagesElement];
    $response = $publisherClient->publish($formattedTopic, $messages);
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();
}

params.name: topic
params.description: The messages in the request will be published on this topic. Format is projects/{project}/topics/{topic}.

params.name: messages
params.description: The messages to publish.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. Can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage.

methods.name: getTopic
methods.description:
Gets the configuration of a topic.

Sample code:

$publisherClient = new PublisherClient();
try {
    $formattedTopic = $publisherClient->topicName('[PROJECT]', '[TOPIC]');
    $response = $publisherClient->getTopic($formattedTopic);
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();

params.name: topic
params.description: The name of the topic to get. Format is projects/{project}/topics/{topic}.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. Can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage.

methods.name: listTopics
methods.description:
Lists matching topics.

Sample code:

$publisherClient = new PublisherClient();
try {
    $formattedProject = $publisherClient->projectName('[PROJECT]');
    // Iterate through all elements
    $pagedResponse = $publisherClient->listTopics($formattedProject);
    foreach ($pagedResponse->iterateAllElements() as $element) {
        // doSomethingWith($element);
    }

    // OR iterate over pages of elements
    $pagedResponse = $publisherClient->listTopics($formattedProject);
    foreach ($pagedResponse->iteratePages() as $page) {
        foreach ($page as $element) {
            // doSomethingWith($element);
        }
    }
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();
}

params.name: project
params.description: The name of the cloud project that topics belong to. Format is projects/{project}.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. The API may return fewer values in a page, even if there are additional values to be retrieved.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageToken
params.description: A page token is used to specify a page of values to be returned. If no page token is specified (the default), the first page of values will be returned. Any page token used here must have been generated by a previous call to the API.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. Can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage.

Sample code:

    $pagedResponse = $publisherClient->listTopicSubscriptions($formattedTopic);
    foreach ($pagedResponse->iteratePages() as $page) {
        foreach ($page as $element) {
            // doSomethingWith($element);
        }
    }
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();

params.name: topic
params.description: The name of the topic that subscriptions are attached to. Format is projects/{project}/topics/{topic}.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageSize
params.description: The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API response. The API may return fewer values in a page, even if there are additional values to be retrieved.

params.name: optionalArgs.pageToken
params.description: A page token is used to specify a page of values to be returned. If no page token is specified (the default), the first page of values will be returned. Any page token used here must have been generated by a previous call to the API.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. Can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage.

methods.name: deleteTopic
methods.description:
Deletes the topic with the given name. Returns NOT_FOUND if the topic does not exist. After a topic is deleted, a new topic may be created with the same name; this is an entirely new topic with none of the old configuration or subscriptions. Existing subscriptions to this topic are not deleted, but their topic field is set to _deleted-topic_.

Sample code:

$publisherClient = new PublisherClient();
try {
    $formattedTopic = $publisherClient->topicName('[PROJECT]', '[TOPIC]');
    $publisherClient->deleteTopic($formattedTopic);
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();
}

params.name: topic
params.description: Name of the topic to delete. Format is projects/{project}/topics/{topic}.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. Can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage.

methods.name: setIamPolicy
methods.description:
Sets the access control policy on the specified resource. Replaces any existing policy.

Sample code:

$publisherClient = new PublisherClient();
try {
    $formattedResource = $publisherClient->topicName('[PROJECT]', '[TOPIC]');
    $policy = new Policy();
    $response = $publisherClient->setIamPolicy($formattedResource, $policy);
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();
}

params.name: resource
params.description: REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being specified. resource is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project resource is specified as projects/{project}.

params.name: policy
params.description: REQUIRED: The complete policy to be applied to the resource. The size of the policy is limited to a few 10s of KB. An empty policy is a valid policy but certain Cloud Platform services (such as Projects) might reject them.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. Can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage.

methods.name: getIamPolicy
methods.description:
Gets the access control policy for a resource.

Returns an empty policy if the resource exists and does not have a policy set.

Sample code:

$publisherClient = new PublisherClient();
try {
    $formattedResource = $publisherClient->topicName('[PROJECT]', '[TOPIC]');
    $response = $publisherClient->getIamPolicy($formattedResource);
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();
}

params.name: resource
params.description: REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy is being requested. resource is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project resource is specified as projects/{project}.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. Can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage.

methods.name: testIamPermissions
methods.description:
Returns permissions that a caller has on the specified resource.

If the resource does not exist, this will return an empty set of permissions, not a NOT_FOUND error.

Sample code:

$publisherClient = new PublisherClient();
try {
    $formattedResource = $publisherClient->topicName('[PROJECT]', '[TOPIC]');
    $permissions = [];
    $response = $publisherClient->testIamPermissions($formattedResource, $permissions);
} finally {
    $publisherClient->close();
}

params.name: resource
params.description: REQUIRED: The resource for which the policy detail is being requested. resource is usually specified as a path. For example, a Project resource is specified as projects/{project}.

params.name: permissions
params.description: The set of permissions to check for the resource. Permissions with wildcards (such as '' or 'storage.') are not allowed. For more information see IAM Overview.

params.name: optionalArgs
params.description: Optional.

params.name: optionalArgs.retrySettings
params.description: Retry settings to use for this call. Can be a Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings object, or an associative array of retry settings parameters. See the documentation on Google\ApiCore\RetrySettings for example usage.
